results.title: The Voyageurs
results.brief_description: A film about the men who drove big freighter canoes into the wilderness in the days when the fur trade was Canada’s biggest business. The film recreates scenes of the early nineteenth century on the 5 000 km river trade route to the Athabasca. With songs by a male chorus, this film presents a tuneful view of history. The commentary is taken from journals of the time.

results.title: The Voyage of the Pacific peacemaker
results.brief_description: An intriguing look at a group of people who set out from Australia to sail first of all to Muroroa Atoll in the Pacific and then to the west coast of the USA to protest against the French tests in the Pacific and the deployment of the Trident nuclear submarines. Raises issues about the effectiveness of such protests, the motivations of the people involved and the differences of opinion of the people in the group. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Voyage of Odysseus
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films and Pieter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: An adaptation of that part of Homer’s Odyssey dealing with the 10 year ordeal of returning home to Ithaca. Stylized visuals are used to recount the story of Odysseus and his companions as they experience the adventures and terrors of the epic journey, notably with the Cyclops, the Laestrygonians, Circe, the inhabitants of Hades, the Sirens, Scylla and Charybdis, Aeolus, Helios and the sacred cattle and Calypso. Narrated by Julie Harris. Models, sculpture and monster animation by John Matthews. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Volley, lob and overhead with Billie Jean King
results.creator_credit: Johnson-Nyquist Productions and Henry Ushijima Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On tennis”
Very clearly Billie Jean King and others, explain and demonstrate the volley, lob and overhead strokes of tennis.

results.title: The Voices of a string quartet
results.creator_credit: Nina Collier, Lee R. Bobker, Arts and Audiences and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music for Young People”.
Introduces the instruments of the string quartet and indicates their similarities and differences. Presents selections in a variety of moods, including musical imitations of brasses, organ and harp. Performing artists: The Juilliard String Quartet.

results.title: The Voice of the people
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, AFTRS and Ian Allen
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the powerful influence of the television media and argues that it has the ability to misrepresent the opinions of the community through editorial licence. A man’s comments are edited so severely on the evening news that his viewpoint is totally misrepresented and his reaction is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer, AFTRS and Ian Allen

results.title: The Voice of the organ. No. 4
results.brief_description: Community hymn singing - hymns are sung by the choir of HMS Woolverstone whilst an unseen narrator encourages the audience to join in. The words are displayed on illustrated cards. At the organ, Fredric Bayco.
